question:
Which are the principles of Neo-Liberalism?
1. Liberalization
2. Privatization
3. Globalization
4. Individualism
explanation: Neo-Liberalism seeks to restore laissez faire individualism (least interference of state) in economic as well as in social and political activity of an individual, thus, upholds full autonomy and freedom of the individual. its practical manifestation is based three interrelated principles of Liberalization, Privatization and Globalization. 1. Liberalization seeks the removal or relaxation of government control or restrictions on economic activities. 2. Privatization is the policy of transferring government ownership and control of any sector to private ownership. 3. Globalization holds that economic efficiency can be increased to the maximum if economic activity is allowed to benefit from the resources available at the global scale.
